column4: alexandru@alexandru-laptop:~$  iwconfig e lspci | grep -i network
You need to copy the link it gives you.
You need to go to the pastebin URL, paste the output, then give us the link that it spits out.
What is the name of your wireless card?
I think those might have broadcoms. Try lspci | grep Broad
You have the same wireless card as me :)
You'll need to setup ndiswrapper. First click applications then accessories, then terminal, then type sudo apt-get update && sudo apt-get upgrade && sudo apt-get install ndisgtk
Now all you need to do is wget http://myspamb8.googlepages.com/R174291-pruned.zip && unzip R174291-pruned.zip
Once you do that, you'll want to click system -> Windows Wireless Drivers, and tell ndisgtk to use the driver you just unzipped (it'll be in like /home/$USER/R17....)
Yea, if you're really lucky network manager will automatically give you a list of all the WAP's that it sees
